actions.text: On agreeing to the Adams amendment (A005) Failed by recorded vote: 192 - 231 (Roll no. 455).
House amendment offered/reported by : Amendment (A005) offered by Ms. Adams.
House amendment not agreed to: On agreeing to the Adams amendment (A005) Failed by recorded vote: 192 - 231 (Roll no. 455).
Roll call votes on amendments in House
Amendment failed in Committee of the Whole

description: Amendment sought to require the owner or operator of a coal combustion residuals surface impoundment to survey all drinking water supply wells that are within a half mile and down-gradient of the established waste boundary and to supply an alternative source of safe drinking water within 24 hours if well water sampling exceeds groundwater standards.
purpose: An amendment numbered 5 printed in Part C of House Report 114-216 to require the owner or operator of a coal combustion residuals surface impoundment to survey all drinking water supply wells that are within a half mile and down-gradient of the established waste boundary. Also requires the owner or operator of a coal combustion residuals surface impoundment to supply an alternative source of safe drinking water within 24 hours if well water sampling exceeds groundwater standards.
